page.title: 16Trenouth and Chaple Farms.
page.content:
Trenouth Farm dates back to 1785 and the present owner has lived there for 28 years with his family. The farmer has 72 acres of land which is mostly pasture. There are a lot of animals, including 3 dairy cows, 78 bullocks, 60 pigs and 16 chickens. The farmer has 3 tractors, 1 muckspreader, a bailer, a hayturner, grass cutter and a sileage cutter. We thought the farm was a bit smelly because he had so many pigs.
Chaple Farm. Chaple Farm has 42 acres of pasture and the farmer ploughs a field every year for kale. He has 15 S.Devon cows for dairy and beef, and 18 chickens. It is called Chaple Farm because the old ruined Chapel of Rosecraddoc Manor was situated on the farms land.
